body: and  reproduction code : https://gist.github.com/skyisle/5553239
Which device is this? Please tell me its a Droid RAZR...
Sorry. It's stock galaxy nexus 4.2.2.
Alright, good to know. I'll try to reproduce this. In the interim you can disable SPDY with setTransports("http/1.1").
Crashes with SSL on Stock HTC One X (Android 4.1.1) too :(
Same here...this seems to be happening on all my devices > 4.1
Nexus 4. OS 4.2.2

issue.title: Picasso call crushes the app with no stacktrace

repository.name: picasso
repository.description: A powerful image downloading and caching library for Android

issue.body:
My app crushes every time when I call .into method. No stacktrace is available.

The only thing I see is:

05-21 14:06:40.728: ASSERT/libc(13236): Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0x00000000 (code=1), thread 13581 (pool-5-thread-7)

For some reasons it doesn't crush on Galaxy S2, but crushes on LG Nexus 4.

Image i try to load is: https://graph.facebook.com/100004056647322/picture?type=large

body: Workaround is to use only OkHttp connection. Possible problems that 3rd party libraries will still use Android UrlConnection that could cause this crushes.

I started running into this on a Nexus 4 after adding Google Analytics to an app that already was using OkHttp (Note the thread name "GAThread": https://gist.github.com/codebutler/5681044). Unfortunately there doesn't seem to be a way to change the HTTPClient used by GA, so "just use OkHttp everywhere" isn't an available workaround.

Please let me know if I can help with debugging.
Doesn't seem to help in my case. I am using OkHttp as transport for both my own API (using Volley) and for gapi-client. Still crashes when SSL endpoints are involved.
Thanks for reporting. I'm able to reproduce this.
Yeah, looks like this occurs consistently if you use OkHttp and HttpURLConnection in the same application.

the workaround is working nice, now i can use spdy and my app is very fast with internet connections.
The problem was as described, i use the twitter4j jar library which is using a httpurlconnection :)
The pull request to allow installing OkHttp as the backer for `URL#openConnection` will also mitigate.

Yup. This is the official workaround:

```
  URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory(new OkHttpClient());
```
Is there any plan / way to fix this issue?

@kkocel yup. Plan is to switch OkHttp to prefer a private default SSL context rather than the shared singleton context. Unfortunately that's an API incompatible change so it'll need to be on a major release. I'm planning a major 2.0 release within 3 months.
The workaround did resolve the issue I was having with bugsense causing the crash, as long as I did it prior to calling BugSenseHandler.initAndStartSession()

issue.title: Unexpected header : status 200 OK

repository.name: okhttp
repository.description: Squares meticulous HTTP client for the JVM, Android, and GraalVM.

issue.body:
I'm not entirely sure if this is a bug in OkHttp (It might be a bug in Picasso as well).

Everything is working fine until fetching images via Picasso (and OkHttp) fails with the following error:

`Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unexpected header: : status: 200 OK
at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.http.RawHeaders.add(RawHeaders.java:199)
at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.http.ResponseHeaders.combine(ResponseHeaders.java:476)
at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.http.HttpEngine.readResponse(HttpEngine.java:636)
at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.http.HttpURLConnectionImpl.execute(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:396)
at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.http.HttpURLConnectionImpl.getResponse(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:345)
at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.http.HttpURLConnectionImpl.getHeaderField(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:192)
at com.squareup.okhttp.internal.http.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getHeaderField(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:260)
at org.gdg.frisbee.android.api.CompatOkHttpLoader.load(CompatOkHttpLoader.java:95)
at com.squareup.picasso.Picasso.loadFromType(Picasso.java:364)
at com.squareup.picasso.Picasso.resolveRequest(Picasso.java:240)
at com.squareup.picasso.Picasso.run(Picasso.java:218)
at com.squareup.picasso.Request.run(Request.java:100)
at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:390)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:234)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1080)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:573)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856)
at com.squareup.picasso.Utils$PicassoThread.run(Utils.java:267)`

CompatOkHttpLoader is nothing special but a copy of OkHttpLoader implementing a workaround for OkHttp Bug #184

body:
In our case, running `URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory` as early as possible (in `MyApplication.onCreate`) didn't seem to fix the problem.

It was easy enough to convert all our uses of OkHttpClient to create their own SSL context but converting Picasso was a little trickier, so now we have [PicassoUtils.with](https://gist.github.com/orip/6061163) instead of `Picasso.with`. Works with Picasso 1.1.1 (easy to make it work with Picasso HEAD).

I am also having issues with Google Analytics when mixed with okhttp. I still get some crashes with `URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory()` but not with [this hack](https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/184#issuecomment-18772733)
